title: This stupid, toxic meta needs to end
body:
I'm of course talking about the one-shot meta. There's no room for strategy or counterplay because 80% of the champions can oneshot you. 

I would GLADLY have another tank meta if it means we get an end to the meta we have now. I would welcome it with open arms. The tank meta at least gave us counterplay, it gave us teamfights that lasted more than 5 seconds. 

I just can't enjoy the meta we have now. I play less and less each day, and I just get more and more frustrated for each game I play. Stop adding more damage, reduce all damage, remove items that are too problematic, increase defences. **Do something balanceteam, before my trust for you disappears completely.** Because I promise you, if this meta doesn't end soon, I will quit the game, and I will never come back.

Tbh at this rate (I hate to be that guy to say this), but there will eventually be a new game that will grab people's attention and it will make less and less people stay interested in playing league.

It's just a mess in every way, except for the art (god bless the visual/audio design team).

This game just needs a complete redo (i'm talking about from the ground up) if they want to people keep playing it (no amount of skins, or new champions is going to fix or help ignore the fact that this game has a lot of issues), because no matter what season it is or what patch it is, it will always be based on a certain "meta" that the game revolves around, making only a small pool of champions playable.

This game is impossible for Rioters to balance because the community doesn't share the exact same preference for "Metas" and it's impossible to meet everyone's wishes.

As much as I love this game sometimes, I can see that it's not going in a good direction. A lot of popular well known/respected players (I don't feel like naming them out, just think about some that you haven't seen in a while) have quit and some are even forgotten just because they don't play the game anymore.

I think even some people in Riot already see the end coming to this game, I mean marc merrill already teased us with a potential MMO game in the future, I wouldn't be surprised if they turned their main focus elsewhere and update the game less.

The game won't be in a place that everyone like its unless they choose to cut out a small group of players for the larger player base. If they stopped doing balance around LCS and top challenger it would make lower elo (80% of the player base) enjoy the game more I am sure because then they could make more champions balanced and would cut down on others.

But things like New champs often, Large reworks on champs, New items, Deleting or changing items, ect, ect every patch or 2 will keep making people less interested. If it goes back to a full "tank" meta I may leave because to be honest being a 5/0 rengar vs a mao and having to run for my life isnt fun. Nor is playing a diver or a burst mage and the ADC has 4k hp in sheilds and gains HP when I try to burst them. I would love for the more balanced meta where any class can be good but people always go back and forth "One shot meta is DUMB!" then "Tank meta is DUMB!" it never ends.

To be honest Assassins aren't suppose to fight tanks, that's quite logical (in any kind of game).

> To be honest Assassins aren't suppose to fight tanks, that's quite logical (in any kind of game).


I would say its a catch 22 though.  Why should someone be so hard countered by a class that even if they are ahead they still just naturally lose?

If ahead then maybe but the thing is Assassin's get ahead easily and naturaly. And if there wasn't atleast a single class that countered them then don't you think it would a little bit pointless to play anything but Assassin's?

Every class is meant to have downsides:

* Mages/Marksman are countered by Tanks and Assassin's.
* Assassin's are countered by Enchanter Supports, and Tanks.
* Fighters are countered by Tanks and Marksman.
* Tanks are countered by Marksman and heavy penetration damage (True Damage Fighters).

It doesn't make sense dynamically either, for an Assassin to be able to burst down a Tank regardless if ahead or not, however they should be able to kill them just not instantly. Why should some wildcat (Rengar for example) be able to kill a Demi-God Forge Being (Ornn for example) instantly.

This just goes to show how little effort some Assassin's need to kill someone when there are so many resources available to get higher burst (Duskblade, Dark Harvest/Electrocute, Stormrazor, Black Cleaver, Lord Dominik's Regards revert). As well as how poorly designed some of them are, due to low interactability (Rengar Q = Basic Attack Bonus damage [undodgeble], Kha'Zix Q point to click [undodgeble], Zed R Point to Click [Undodgeble] and damage unavoidable [without Zhonias] since Basic Attacks add on to the deathmark damage).

On top of all that (I know not everyone is like this) but some people who main Assassin's say that Assassin's should be able to do this and that and the eay that they say these thing suggests that they hold some sort of supremacy balief when it comes to their class, that they should be the most dominant and that they should be able to beat everyone.

Rather that than the oneshot meta we have now

The solution is this: Pick a well rounded team. A well rounded team usually has a tank and the most recent "meta" is not even a real meta, it's just players who forgot how to pick a good team and they call it meta and want Riot to fix it.

Tanks are always meta. Having a reliable frontline is just so important. If you don't have frontline and you fall behind, you just lose, because nobody can take the first hit, which is exactly what the recent trend was. Everyone wants to pick damage, teams are not well rounded and games are incredibly snowbally as a result. 

Players want Riot to fix it, but this is bullshit. There is nothing to fix. The players need to learn. This has always been the main issue with every meta that became stale.

For every meta there is also a way out, without Riot "fixing" the game.
Right now I think were shifting into a tankier meta so im'ma just wait it out.
Adressing lower damage creep would also need Ninja Tabi's change to be reverted.
